intro: Mitranthes eugenioides var. ovata, commonly known as the ovate false oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves that are ovate in shape, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
